tutorials.topic: How can I find a place to live?
tutorials.answer: You can find a place you like from the many listings on EuroFugees. You can find something as small as your own room, to as large as an entire house. You can search for a home by location, accommodations, number of bedrooms/bathroom, and even by square footage.

tutorials.topic: What do I do once I’ve found a place I like?
tutorials.answer: Once you’ve found a place you like, you can contact the landlord and submit and application to live there. In the application you will indicate you personal and contact information, along with other important information like how many people are with you and refugee identification.

tutorials.topic: What do I do once I’ve applied?
tutorials.answer: Once you've applied to a place, make sure you’re also applying to other places in case you are not accepted to your first choice. You know wait until a landlord gets back to you.
Once you're accepted, provide the tenancy agreement to the social services department. Once the department checks it, you can the landlord must both sign it.

During the handover you will check the condition and state of the property before moving in. If you damage anything that isn't noted in the hand over, once you move out, you need to pay for those damaged.
